definition[0]: the principle of allowing people and goods to move into a country freely
example[0]: They’re pushing forward economic reform and an open-door policy.
definition[1]: the principle of allowing anyone to come to a place at any time, for example in order to discuss something
definition[2]: when a country encourages businesses from other countries to invest in it and to trade with it
example[1]: ‘We are trying to follow an open-door policy, ’ said the finance minister.
definition[3]: an official system where the top managers of a company deal with employees’ complaints
example[2]: The company has an open-door policy that allows employees to pursue complaints against their supervisor all the way to the chairman’s office.
